alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 1:53PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet expected along St George Island. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, through 4 AM EST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Expect peak water levels of 1 to 2 feet above normally dry ground along the coast around the time of high tide. Impacts at these water levels often flood boat ramps around Apalachicola and result in minor overwash along Alligator Point Road. High tide at Apalachicola is at 334 pm ET today and again at 1232 am ET Saturday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
